Linosyris species are typically found in freshwater habitats such as ponds, lakes, and wetlands. They exhibit a unique photosynthetic adaptation, with some species capable of performing both photosynthesis and carnivory. The genus includes around 30 species, many of which are distributed across temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
